name: Global March Against Child Labour
goal:
The Global March Against Child Labour (GMACL) works to ensure that all children can enjoy all their rights, that they have a free quality public education, and that they are protected from doing any work that could harm them or hinder their development.

The GMACL believes that by generating a very high level of public awareness and commitment child labour eradication and education for all is possible to achieve.

The GMACL believes that the voice and leadership of former and existing child labourers and youth advocates must be included in the struggle against child labour and this involvement and empowerment will demonstrate the power that children can have in shaping the future of our world.

The GMACL commits to compel widespread government action to ratify and implement ILO Conventions 182 and 138 and other related child labour treaties/Conventions within the ongoing poverty alleviation framework.

The GMACL commits to compel widespread government action to provide free quality public education to all girls and boys in order to implement the Education 2030 Framework of Action.

The GMACL is driven to bring together policy and action for a unified response to a triangular paradigm of development addressing child labour, poverty, and lack of quality comprehensive education that affect the lives of children within the ongoing efforts of the Sustainable Development Goals.

GMACL believes:

Child labour is a universal human rights violation and must be eradicated;

Child labour is an impediment to poverty alleviation and sustainable human development;

Child labour is the largest obstacle in achieving the right to education for all children; and

The elimination of child labour is a core responsibility of the state and is achievable if governments mobilise the political will and available resources.

GMACL calls for:

An end to child labour;

Free, compulsory, good quality public education for all children; and

The mobilisation of political will and resources to substantially increase aid/budgets for protecting and promoting the rights of children and their overall well being and future.
interests: Banking and financial services, Business and Industry, Consumers, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, External Relations, Foreign affairs and security policy, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, International co-operation and development, Trade
